bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 8, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg sends Hench a proof of an insert prepared by the Wyeth Company that is to appear in "Modern Medicine."

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 8, 1942
div1.opener:
Y F
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
257 CORNELISON AVENUE
JERSEY CITY, N.J.
May 8, 1942.
Dear Dr. Hench
div1.p:
The accompanying proof of an insert which
will run in MODERN MEDICINE arrived in my office this
afternoon. On reading the copy which was submitted from
Philadelphia I had the feeling that there were several
phrases that you would change and even though our time
is very short I would like to have you make the changes
in accordance with your own beliefs and send them direct
to

Mr. Charles Rogers
John Wyeth & Brother, Inc
1600 Arch Street
Philadelphia, Penna.

It might be better for you to send him a
collect wire as they are anxious to get this job on the
press this coming Tuesday.

In the event that this letter should not reach
you in Milwaukee I am sending a duplicate of the copy and
a carbon of this letter to the Mayo Clinic in Rochester.
This is a very small insert but we have to remember that
it reaches very many doctors not reached by the JOURNAL OF
THE AMERICAN MEDICAL ASSOCIATION and for that reason I am
really more worried about the copy than I was when we ran
the insert in the official publication.

In the event that you should wish to call me
put in a reversed charges call to
Ridgewood 6-6814J
at any time over the
weekend.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, George A. Kellogg Dr. Philip S. Hench
c/o University Club
Milwaukee, Wisconsin
